claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A table listing four quadrivalent influenza vaccines (trade name, manufacturer) with details on presentation (dose volume and format), age indication, antigen content per dose, route of administration, and presence of mercury (thimerosal). Vaccines include Fluad Quadrivalent (egg-based adjuvanted IIV4), Flublok Quadrivalent (recombinant HA RIV4), and FluMist Quadrivalent (egg-based live attenuated LAIV4). Abbreviations and footnotes are provided. does not support the claim because the table only presents formulation and dosing information for various flu vaccines and does not mention or provide data on mutations arising during egg- or cell-based production or any impact on effectiveness.
